result.execSummary:
The defendant Lewis Mitchell Edwards was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery with Threat of Force [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:  Pay DNA surcharge, all applicable court costs.  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Pay all applicable fees of supervision.
Restitution set at zero.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes:
No further violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No possession of alcohol or illegal drugs.

Cooperate with probation department.
Cooperate with the probation agent.

supervisions.notes: Court orders no other specific programing conditions. Defendant must complete a Risk and Needs Assessment wit DOC, and comply with case plan goals related to prioritized need areas as identified.

Provide a DNA sample.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm; and that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

charges.descr: Armed Robbery with Threat of Force

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lewis Mitchell Edwards

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (14 pages) commencing 11-02-2015 received and filed. CH

Defendant Lewis Mitchell Edwards in court with attorney Daniel Morgan Adams.  Defendant Lewis Mitchell Edwards in custody.  Ron Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  
PSI reviewed and corrections made.  
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  19 YEARS with 116 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 9 YEAR; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 10 YEARS.

Court finds defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program or the WI Substance Abuse program.  
Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- No further violations rising to the level of probable cause
- Cooperate with the Probation Department.  -Cooperate with the probation agent.
- No possession of alcohol or illegal drugs;
- Provide a DNA sample.
  Court orders no other specific programming conditions.  Defendant must complete a risk and needs assessment with DOC and comply with case plan goals related to prioritized need areas so identified.
Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution in the amount of $0
Pay DNA surcharges;
Pay all applicable court costs.
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter
The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Defense Sentencing Memorandum dated 11/2/2015
Victim Impact Statement
Pretrial Incarceration Credit
Received, signed, and filed with court.

Defendant Lewis Mitchell Edwards in court with attorney Daniel Morgan Adams.  Defendant Lewis Mitchell Edwards in custody.  Ron Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  Defendant is ordered to provide a DNA sample.  Defendant is REMANDED.
Court Orders PSI report.  Order for Presentence Investigation Report (PSI) signed and FILED.
Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 19.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Order to Produce for Plea Hearing on August 28, 2015 @ 8:30am received and filed

Attorney Daniel Morgan Adams in court, defendant Lewis Mitchell Edwards not in court, in custody.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for pre-trial conference.  Defense requests projected guilty plea date.    All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Dennis Cimpl, Branch 19, in Room 313 of the Safety Building due to rotation.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Daniel Morgan Adams in court, defendant Lewis Mitchell Edwards not in court, in custody.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Parties request a pre-trial date on the same day as the co-defendant.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Daniel Morgan Adams in court, defendant Lewis Mitchell Edwards not in court, in custody.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for pre-trial conference.  State requests more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Status conference scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Daniel Morgan Adams in court, defendant Lewis Mitchell Edwards not in court, in custody.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Daniel Morgan Adams in court, defendant Lewis Mitchell Edwards not in court, in custody.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lewis Mitchell Edwards in court with attorney Daniel M. Adams.  Defendant Lewis Mitchell Edwards in custody.  David Behm for Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.

Defendant Lewis Mitchell Edwards in court with attorney Patrick Flanagan.  Defendant Lewis Mitchell Edwards in custody.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
